result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm With Intent To Cause Bodily Harm) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs and fees due to indigency.
Restitution set at ZERO.

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
The defendant is advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.

timeConds.notes: Perform 30 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.

charges.descr: Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm With Intent To Cause Bodily Harm)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerrie Lashon Profit

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 109 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 14 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs and fees due to indigency. 
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Seek and maintain full-time employment.
Perform 30 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
No contact with the victim.
Restitution set at ZERO.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case proceeded to sentencing. 

FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Court will be in Jury Trial on another matter and ordered case adjourned. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Bail/bond hearing. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered no contact with EDJ.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Gerrie Lashon Profit in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
